data.title: Duchy of Braunschweig (Brunswick)
data.meta_description: The Duchy of Braunschweig (Brunswick) existed between 1235 and 1918. Its flag - available on this site - was mostly blue and golden striped. The origin of the colours should go back to the reduced Danish coat of arms.
data.text:
1142 Â· Henry the Lion of the House of Guelph (Welf) receives Brunswick and the Duchy of Saxony as a fiefdom

1154 Â· Henry the Lion becomes Duke of Bavaria

1180 Â· in the conflict with the Staufen Emperor, Henry gets outlawed, in the following struggles Henry subjects and loses all possessions (even Bavaria), except Brunswick and Lueneburg, and some very small areas, Duke of Saxony becomes the Bernhard I. of Anhalt (Ascanian Dynasty)

1235 Â· Otto the Child transfersall his possessions back to the Emperor, these become summarized as Duchy of Brunswick and e-transmited to Henry, as the Duke of Brunswick

1269 Â· The Duchy of Brunswick becomes divided into the Principality of Brunswick and the Principality of Lueneburg, however, it remains formally as Duchy of Brunswick-Lueneburg

1291 Â· in consequence of further divisions arise, inter alia, the Principality of Calenberg-Goettingen and the Principality of Brunswick-Wolfenbuettel, the Brunswick principalities (except Brunswick-Wolfenbuettel) become united in the following years, and form from 1692 the Electorate of Brunswick-Lueneburg (also called: Electorate of Hanover)

1792, 1796, 1800 and 1805 Â· invasions of French revolutionary troops under NapolÃ©on into the German Empire, the German Empire subjects and becomes territorially transformed by NapolÃ©on: church possessions become confiscated, old princely territories become repealed and transferred to other old or new principalities

1st of August in 1806 Â· the Holy Roman Empire of German Nation ends

1807 Â· Napoleon forms the Kingdom of Westphalia under his brother JÃ©rÃ´me, it were merged not only territories of Brunswick, Prussia and Hesse, from 1810 even the whole Electorate of Hanover, the Duchy of Brunswick ends

1813 Â· NapolÃ©on defeats at Leipzig in October

18141815 Â· Vienna Congress, reorganization of Europe after the Napoleonic era, the Duchy of Brunswick becomes re-installed under Duke Friedrich Wilhelm of Brunswick-Wolfenbuettel, Brunswick joins the German Confederation

1830 Â· uprising, Duke Charles II. flees to Switzerland, the new Duke is his brother William

1834 Â· Customs Union with Hanover

1841 Â· accession to the German Customs Union

1866 Â· Fratricidal War of Prussia against Austria, Brunswick is on the side of Prussia that wins the war

1871 Â· accession to the German Empire

1884 Â· Death of Duke William, extinction of the line of Brunswick-Wolfenbuettel, the succession has to go to Ernst August from Hanover (actually Brunswick-Lueneburg), Duke of Cumberland, he should ascend the throne, but Hanover and his Guelph (Welf) dynasty was one of the most powerful enemies of Prussia in the Fratricidal War of 1866, while Prussia was victorious in this war  the Kingdom of Hanover became terminated by Prussia and was incorporated to Prussia as a province, but Prussia did not want see any new Hanoverian dynasty on a German throne

2nd of November 1885 Â· decision of the Federal Council: the throne goes to Prince Albert of Prussia, as regent

1906 Â· death of Prince Albert

5th of June in 1907 Â· decision of the Federal Council: the throne goes to Johann Albrecht, Duke of Mecklenburg, as regent

24th of May in 1913 Â· Ernst August of Hanover, son of Ernst August Duke of Cumberland, marries Princess Viktoria Luise of Prussia, reconciliation between Hanover and Prussia

27th of November in 1913 Â· The Duke of Cumberland waived his claim to the throne of Brunswick

28th of November in 1913 Â· decision of the Federal Council: the throne goes to Ernst August of Hanover from the line of Brunswick-Lueneburg (Duke of Brunswick, Duke of Brunswick and Lueneburg, Prince of Hanover)

1st of November in 1913 Â· move of the dukal couple to Brunswick

8th of November in 1918 Â· overthrow of the monarchy

10th of November in 1918 Â· proclamation of the Socialist Republic of Brunswick

6th of January in 1922 Â· proclamation of the Free State of Brunswick

1934 Â· the territorial structure of the states of the German Empire becomes replaced by the districts of the NSDAP, the countries become meaningless

1945 Â· Brunswick is part of the British and part of the Soviet occupation zone

July 1945 Â· the Soviet-occupied areas of Brunswick become annexed to the new created Country Province of Saxony-Anhalt

23rd of November in 1946 Â· the British military government initiates the unification of Brunswick (only the parts of the British occupation zone) with Hanover, Oldenburg and Schaumburg-Lippe to the Country of Lower Saxony
